unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss That Awesome Deal!
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss That Awesome Deal!

unnormalised: Hey folks! Ever felt that adrenaline rush when you stumble upon a ridiculously good deal online, but you know you only have a limited time to grab it? That, my friends, is the magic of a flash sale. It’s like a Diwali cracker – bright, exciting, and gone in a flash!
normalised: Hey folks! Ever felt that adrenaline rush when you stumble upon a ridiculously good deal online, but you know you only have a limited time to grab it? That, my friends, is the magic of a flash sale. It's like a Diwali cracker – bright, exciting, and gone in a flash!

unnormalised: Think about it: you're scrolling through Myntra (happens to the best of us!), and BAM! A 70% off sale on all Anouk kurtis. Your brain goes into overdrive. Should you buy that gorgeous indigo one you've been eyeing? Is that a good price for a gift for your cousin, Priya's, wedding? The clock is ticking! That, my friends, is the power of FOMO – Fear of Missing Out – perfectly harnessed by flash sales.

unnormalised: But are they *really* worth it? Well, that depends. Often, these sales are on specific items to clear out old inventory. Maybe last season's designs or items that haven't been selling as well as hoped. Think of it like the "clearance sale" section at Big Bazaar, only online and with a much shorter deadline.

unnormalised: From a retail perspective, flash sales are brilliant. They create a sense of urgency and drive immediate sales. Imagine a small boutique in Colaba, Mumbai, needing to free up space in its 500 sq ft shop. A 24-hour flash sale can do wonders! It gets people talking, brings in new customers, and of course, boosts those Rs. figures on the balance sheet.
normalised: From a retail perspective, flash sales are brilliant. They create a sense of urgency and drive immediate sales. Imagine a small boutique in Colaba, Mumbai, needing to free up space in its five hundred square feet shop. A twenty four hour flash sale can do wonders! It gets people talking, brings in new customers, and of course, boosts those rupees figures on the balance sheet.

unnormalised: However, always remember to do your research. Sometimes, what seems like a fantastic discount is actually not that great if you compare it to the original price (especially before the “discount season” started!). Plus, don’t get caught up in the hype and buy something you don’t really need! We don't want you ending up with 5 more bandhini dupattas, just because they were on sale, right? Dr. Sharma, your family physician, would advise against such impulsive shopping sprees!

unnormalised: So, next time you see a flash sale pop up, take a deep breath, consider your needs, and happy shopping! Just remember, sometimes the best deals are the ones you skip. ;)
